data.title: Bharat Electronics shares in focus on orders win of Rs 732 crore
data.description:
Bharat Electronics share price is likely to extend gains on the second day on October 31 after the company secured additional orders worth Rs 732 crore.

Major orders received include Software Defined Radios (SDRs), tank sub systems, communication equipment, missile components, financial management software, cyber security solution, upgrades, spares, services etc, company said.

The SDRs are the first fully indigenous radios, jointly designed and developed with DRDO and manufactured by BEL. These state-of-the art SDRs are interoperable with existing/legacy radios and facilitate smooth transition between technologies. These cutting-edge technology SDRs will ensure secure, real-time communications and strengthen the Army's operational readiness in today's challenging network-centric battlefields, it added further.

Catch all the market action on our live blog

Earlier in this month, the company received order valued at Rs 633 crore from Cochin Shipyard and also secured additional orders worth Rs 592 crore includes tank subsystems and overhauling, communication equipment, combat management system, ship data network, train collision avoidance system (Kavach), laser dazzler, jammers, upgrades, spares, services.

In the previous trading session, the share closed down 0.39 percent or Rs 1.60 at Rs 413.60.

The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 435.95 and a 52-week low of Rs 240.15 on 01 July, 2025 and 19 February, 2025, respectively.

Currently, the stock is trading 5.96 percent below its 52-week high and 70.71 percent above its 52-week low.The market capitalisation of the company stands at Rs 297,690.74 crore.

data.title: MTAR Technologies shares in focus on winning international order
data.description:
MTAR Technologies share price will remain in focus on October 31 following the company received an international order from the existing customer.

"..... received an orders worth USD 29.95 million (Rs 263.54 crore approximately) which is to be executed in next one-year.

Catch all the market action on our live blog

The meeting of board of director of the company will be held on November 5, 2025 to consider and approve the un-audited financial results standalone and consolidated for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025 and scheme of arrangement.

Earlier in this month the company received an orders worth USD 7.6 million (Rs 67.16 crore), to be executed in by June 2026.

In the previous trading session, the share price touched a 52-week high of Rs 2,473.95, closing at Rs 2,281.40, up 2.27 percent or Rs 50.60.The market capitalisation of the company stands at Rs 7,243.73 crore.

data.title: CapitaLand Integrated Commercial's Asset Upgrades to Drive Earnings — Market Talk
data.description: CapitaLand Integrated Commercial Trust's planned asset enhancements are likely to drive its near-term operational performance, says RHB Research's Vijay Natarajan in a note. The Singapore REIT's 3Q operational metrics improved on quarter with notable occupancy improvement in Singapore and overseas office assets, the analyst says. Its local retail portfolio's income is likely to grow as the REIT continues to enhance its assets in Singapore, he adds. The company projects for low-to-middle single digit growth in rents renewed next year, he notes, adding that the outlook for rent renewals for retail and office portfolios remain upbeat. RHB Research raises the target price to S$2.69 from S$2.44 and maintains a buy rating. The units are down 0.8% to S$2.35. (megan.cheah@wsj.com)

data.title: KOSPI Extends Record Rally
data.description:
The benchmark KOSPI rose 0.6% to around 4,110 on Friday, hitting fresh record levels, boosted by gains in automakers and chip giant Samsung Electronics.

The index is also on track for its fifth straight weekly gain and a nearly 20% increase for the month.

Carmaker Hyundai Motors led the charge, climbing over 6% to a three-month high, while its sister-company Kia Corp surged 2.6%, following news that the Korea-US trade deal was finalized to lower tariffs on auto exports to 15%.

Shipbuilding stocks also advanced, as the trade deal highlighted shipbuilding and energy as major areas of South Korea’s planned investment in the US. Additionally, chip heavyweight Samsung Electronics jumped 0.8% to a new record-high, while its peer SK Hynix dropped 1.1%.

Investor optimism was supported by corporate developments, as leaders from US tech giant Nvidia, Samsung, and Hyundai met in Seoul ahead of a planned announcement on their AI business cooperation.

data.title: Singapore Bank Lending Hits Record High
data.description: Singapore’s bank loans rose to SGD 863.8 billion in September 2025, up from SGD 851.7 billion in August, marking a record high after posting the smallest increase in four months in the previous month.

data.title: PetroChina's Third-Quarter Profit Falls Amid Lower Oil Prices
data.description:
By Jason Chau

PetroChina's third-quarter net profit fell 3.9% from a year earlier amid lower oil prices and weaker domestic demand for refined products.

The Chinese energy major's net profit for the quarter ended September was 42.29 billion yuan, equivalent to $5.95 billion, the company said late Thursday.

Revenue rose 2.3% to 719.16 billion yuan.

The average realized price for crude oil fell 15% to $65.55 a barrel over the first nine months of the year, it said.

PetroChina said it kept crude production and natural gas output broadly stable, while striving to keep costs under control.

PetroChina has been facing a decline in demand for refined oil products in China, while growth in domestic natural gas consumption has also slowed. The company said the supply-demand balance in international crude oil markets remains generally loose, with oil prices trending downward.

PetroChina is the listed arm of state-owned China National Petroleum Corp.

Write to Jason Chau at jason.chau@wsj.com

data.title: Iron ore slips on falling demand, rising stocks; eyes weekly, monthly gains
data.description:
Iron ore futures slid on Friday, weighed down by dwindling demand and rising inventories in top consumer China, but hopes of a trade deal between the world's two-largest economies kept prices on track for weekly and monthly gains.

The most-traded January iron ore contract on China's Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) fell 0.93% to 797 yuan ($111.89) a metric ton as of 0148 GMT, rising 3.3% so far this week.

The benchmark December iron ore (SZZFZ5) on the Singapore Exchange fell 0.61% to $105.8 a ton as of 0138 GMT, gaining 2% so far this week.

Both benchmarks posted a monthly gain of around 2% on optimism of a trade deal during a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, on Thursday.

Following the meeting, Trump said he had agreed with Xi to lower tariffs on China in exchange for Beijing cracking down on the illicit fentanyl trade, resuming U.S. soybean purchases and keeping rare earths exports flowing.

The macro-led driving forces receded after the Trump-Xi meeting, analysts at broker First Futures said.

But as the macro boost had been fully priced in, investors shifted focus back to weakening fundamentals of the key steelmaking ingredient.

Average daily hot metal output, a gauge of iron ore demand, fell 1.5% week-on-week to 2.36 million tons as of October 30, while portside inventories rose 0.8% in the same period, data from consultancy Mysteel showed.

Further pressuring prices was downbeat data, with China's factory activity shrinking for a seventh month in October, an official survey showed on Friday.

Coking coal NYMEX:ACT1! and coke (DCJcv1), other steelmaking ingredients, rose 1.04% and 0.58%, respectively.

Most steel benchmarks on the Shanghai Futures Exchange lost ground. Rebar shed 0.19%, hot-rolled coil dipped 0.21%, stainless steel slipped 0.43%, while wire rod (SWRcv1) added 0.12%.

($1 = 7.1230 Chinese yuan)

data.title: Key facts: UniCredit raises Alpha Bank stake to 29.5%; enforces capital rules; drops Banco BPM bid
data.description:
• UniCredit raised its stake in Alpha Bank to 29.5% from 26%, following ECB approval. This move may allow UniCredit to consolidate Alpha Bank's earnings into its results.12
  • UniCredit will enforce new capital requirements from January 1, 2026, including a 10.24% CET1 ratio, 12.11% Tier 1 ratio, and 14.61% Total Capital ratio.3
  • UniCredit has dropped its bid for Banco BPM, prompting Credit Agricole to raise its stake in Banco BPM to nearly 20% to protect its consumer credit and insurance deals.4

data.title: Key facts: Mercedes-Benz stock drops 1.07%; semiconductor shortage concerns
data.description:
• Mercedes-Benz Group's stock closed at 56.43 euros, reflecting a decrease of 0.61 euros or 1.07% in the latest trading session.1
  • Mercedes-Benz is worried about a worsening semiconductor shortage impacting vehicle production, worsened by a dispute between the Netherlands and China over the Dutch chipmaker Nexperia.2

data.title: Key facts: Banco Santander repurchases 14.8% of shares; ECB keeps P2R at 1.74%
data.description:
• Banco Santander repurchased 14.8% of its outstanding shares from October 23 to 29, 2025, spending 940.9 million Euros, or 55.3% of its buyback budget.12
  • Banco Santander has confirmed that the European Central Bank (ECB) will maintain an unchanged Pillar 2 Requirement (P2R) of 1.74% at a consolidated level.3

data.title: Key facts: Airbus delivers 507 aircraft; Vietjet orders 100 A321neo jets
data.description:
• Airbus delivered 507 aircraft by September and aims for 820 this year, despite supply-chain issues. Shares rose 2.2% to 213.00 euros amid 32 aircraft awaiting engines.1
  • Vietjet has finalized a multi-billion-dollar order for 100 Airbus A321neo jets, valued at approximately $25 billion, confirming a previous memorandum of understanding signed in June.2
  • Airbus reported earnings that exceeded expectations, resulting in a positive market response.3

data.title: Key facts: Adidas shares rise 2.2%; €500 million bond issued
data.description:
• Adidas shares increased by 2.2% after the release of its earnings report, positively impacting the German DAX index.1
  • Adidas AG has issued a €500 million bond, enhancing its financial position and providing capital for future investments.2

data.title: Key facts: UBS to appeal court ruling on Credit Suisse bonds; initiates debt offers
data.description:
• UBS Group plans to appeal a Swiss court ruling that found no legal basis for the elimination of more than $17 billion in Credit Suisse bonds during its state-backed rescue takeover.1
  • UBS Group AG has initiated cash tender offers for debt securities, launching seven concurrent and separate offers to purchase outstanding notes, with a deadline set for October 30, 2025.2

data.title: Key facts: TotalEnergies Q3 earnings rise; Mozambique LNG budget at $20.5B; Papua LNG costs revised
data.description:
• TotalEnergies SE reported Q3 adjusted earnings of $1.77 per share, slightly up from $1.74 year-over-year, with net income at $4.0 billion and cash flow of $7.1 billion.12
  • TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne announced the Mozambique LNG project's budget is now $20.5 billion, up from $15.5 billion, clarifying the need for additional funds during a four-year freeze.3
  • TotalEnergies is revising its Papua LNG project to lower costs, addressing challenges related to rising construction expenses and financing issues that are impacting new LNG projects.4

data.title: Key facts: Telefonica to sell Mexico unit for €500M; Virgin Media O2 partners with Starlink
data.description:
• Telefonica is planning to sell its subsidiary in Mexico to Beyond One for over 500 million euros, as reported by Spanish newspaper Cinco Dias.1
  • Telefonica's Virgin Media O2 partners with Starlink to enhance mobile coverage in rural UK, aiming to launch messaging and data services in early 2026.2

data.title: Key facts: Novo Nordisk bids $9B for Metsera; Wegovy sales slow
data.description:
• Novo Nordisk has made a $9 billion bid for Metsera, offering $56.50 per share. Metsera's stock rose over 18% in premarket trading as the board reviews the proposal.123
  • Novo Nordisk's Wegovy, the first highly effective obesity drug approved in the U.S. in 2021, is facing slowing sales amid intensifying competition in the obesity drug market.4

data.title: Key facts: Maersk invests $2B in India's Pipavav Port; launches $100M cold store
data.description:
• Maersk's APM Terminals will invest $2 billion in India's Pipavav Port to boost capacity and strengthen supply chain resilience, aiming to increase domestic tonnage.1
  • Maersk has launched the Belcon Cold Store in Cape Town, a $100 million investment to boost cold chain logistics and support perishable exports ahead of the 2025 citrus season.2

data.title: Key facts: Ferrari stock rises 1.70% to €341.70; student invests in shares
data.description:
• Ferrari's stock closed at €341.70, marking an increase of €5.70 or 1.70% in the latest trading session.1
  • Max Provencher, a 21-year-old student, invested in Ferrari shares after a price drop, showing individual investor interest in the company's performance amid market changes.2

data.title: Key facts: BNP Paribas faces scrutiny over $500M telecom loans; reveals positions
data.description:
• BNP Paribas financed over $500 million in loans to telecom firms linked to Bankim Brahmbhatt, now facing a fraud lawsuit over fake accounts receivable, increasing scrutiny on the bank.1
  • On October 30, 2025, BNP Paribas London revealed its public position under Rule 8.3 of the Takeover Code, outlining interests and short positions in relevant securities.2

data.title: Dollar Heads for Monthly Gain
data.description:
The dollar index held near three-month highs around 99.5 on Friday and was poised to rise nearly 2% for the month as investors dialed back expectations for further Federal Reserve rate cuts.

The Fed delivered a widely anticipated quarter-point reduction on Wednesday, but Chair Jerome Powell stressed that another move in December is not guaranteed.

Market-implied odds of a December cut fell sharply to about 75% from over 90% before the meeting.

Meanwhile, the Trump-Xi meeting ended with the US agreeing to lower tariffs on Chinese goods, while Beijing pledged to curb fentanyl exports, boost US soybean purchases, and pause rare earth export controls.

The dollar posted its biggest monthly gains against the yen in October following the election of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, who favors expansionary fiscal measures and continued loose monetary policy.

data.title: First Tick: Top global cues to watch in today’s trade
data.description:
Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a muted start today, with cues coming from GIFT Nifty, which was trading with little change around 26,042.50.

Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol.

After opening under the 26,000 mark, the benchmark index Nifty 50 gave way to selling pressure, while the 30-share Sensex pack tumbled 500 points on October 30. Globally, sentiment remained cautious after the U.S. Federal Reserve cut rates by 25 basis points while signaling the possibility of a pause in further easing this year.

The Nifty struggled to hold higher levels, with persistent selling dragging it lower, leading the index to close at 25,877.85 - down 176.05 points or 0.68 percent. Meanwhile, Sensex closed at 84,404.46, lower by 592.67 points or 0.70 percent on its monthly expiry.

Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight:

GIFT Nifty (Flat)

The GIFT Nifty is trading flat at around 26,042.50, suggesting a muted start for the day.

Asian Equities (Gain)

Asian equities climbed close to their record and US equity-index futures advanced as strong earnings from Amazon.com Inc. and Apple Inc. lifted sentiment after a brief pause in the global stock rally.

data.title: China Factory Activity Gauge Signals Deepening Manufacturing Gloom
data.description:
An official gauge of China's official manufacturing activity fell markedly for October, signaling mounting growth headwinds in the world's second-largest economy at the start of the final quarter of the year.

The official manufacturing purchasing managers index slid to 49.0 for October, from 49.8 in September, China's National Bureau of Statistics said Friday.

The result missed the 49.6 forecast by economists in a Wall Street Journal survey, marking the seventh straight month below the 50 threshold that separates activity expansion from contraction.

The production subindex declined to 49.7 from 51.9 in September, ending five months of expansion. The subindex for total new orders slid to 48.8 in October from to 49.7 in September, while new export orders fell to 45.9 from 47.8 in September.

Meanwhile, China's nonmanufacturing PMI, which covers both service and construction activity, edged up to 50.1 for October from 50.0 in September, the statistics bureau said.

The subindex tracking service activity rose to 50.2 from 50.1 in September, while the construction subindex declined to 49.1 from 49.3 in September.

Write to Singapore Editors at singaporeeditors@dowjones.com

data.title: South Korea's Lee says global trade order at critical inflection point
data.description:
South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Friday the Asia-Pacific region was at a critical inflection point with a rapidly changing global economic order, as he chaired a leaders' summit in the city of Gyeongju.

Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent joined the annual summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) grouping, a non-binding 21-member forum.

The APEC region accounts for 50% of global trade and 61% of GDP, and this year's meeting follows Xi's high-profile meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to find a trade war truce on the sidelines of the gathering in South Korea.

"It is clear we cannot always be on the same side, but we must work together to achieve common prosperity," Lee said.

"As the free trade order undergoes dramatic changes, global economic uncertainty is deepening and trade and investment are losing momentum," Lee added, noting cooperation among APEC members was a "clear solution" to the current economic challenges.
